text: method evaluates significativity \(\sigma\)-value. uses Monte Carlo method default uniformly samples set \(n \times n\)-confusion matrices summing \(m\). number_of_samples set NULL, computation considers \(n \times n\)-confusion matrices.

title: Estimate the \(\sigma\)-significativity of \(c\) in \(\mathcal{M}_{n,m}\) — M_significativity
text: sigma statistical coefficient. n number rows/columns confusion matrix. m sum confusion matrix elements. number_of_samples number samples used evaluate significativity using Monte Carlo method (default: 10000). number_of_samples set NULL, function use Monte Carlo method computes significativity considering confusion matrices \(\mathcal{M}_{n,m}\).

title: Estimate the \(\sigma\)-significativity of \(c\) in \(\mathcal{M}_{n,m}\) — M_significativity
code: kappa <- function(conf_matrix) {     p_o <- sum(diag(conf_matrix)) / sum(conf_matrix)      # Calculate the expected agreement (P_e)     row_totals <- rowSums(conf_matrix)     col_totals <- colSums(conf_matrix)     total <- sum(conf_matrix)     p_e <- sum((row_totals * col_totals) / total^2)      # Calculate Cohen's kappa     kappa <- (p_o - p_e) / (1 - p_e)      return(kappa) }  # evaluate kappa-significativity of 0.5 in M_{2,100} with 10000 samples M_significativity(kappa, n = 2, m = 100, c = 0.5) #> [1] 0.8695  # evaluate kappa-significativity of 0.5 in M_{2,100} with 1000 samples M_significativity(kappa, n = 2, m = 100, c = 0.5, number_of_samples = 1000) #> [1] 0.869  # evaluate kappa-significativity of 0.5 in M_{2,5} with 1000 samples M_significativity(kappa, n = 2, m = 5, c = 0.5, number_of_samples = 1000) #> [1] 0.557  # exactly compute kappa-significativity of 0.5 in M_{2,5} M_significativity(kappa, n = 2, m = 5, c = 0.5, number_of_samples = NULL) #> [1] 0.5714286

code: kappa <- function(conf_matrix) {     p_o <- sum(diag(conf_matrix)) / sum(conf_matrix)      # Calculate the expected agreement (P_e)     row_totals <- rowSums(conf_matrix)     col_totals <- colSums(conf_matrix)     total <- sum(conf_matrix)     p_e <- sum((row_totals * col_totals) / total^2)      # Calculate Cohen's kappa     kappa <- (p_o - p_e) / (1 - p_e)      return(kappa) }  # evaluate kappa-significativity of 0.5 in P_{2} with 10000 samples P_significativity(kappa, n = 2, c = 0.5) #> [1] 0.8927  # evaluate kappa-significativity of 0.5 in P_{2} with 1000 samples P_significativity(kappa, n = 2, c = 0.5, number_of_samples = 1000) #> [1] 0.9
